text: Grains of sand dance in the wind.  As we glide over a VAS DESERT, the speck of dust becomes a HORSE AND RIDER.  CATHERINE YOUNG straddles the beautiful black animal, her mesmerizing eyes scanning the horizon.  A curious breeze blows across her exquisite face and she drinks it in, as the wind itself were telling something to her... Catherine sees a FLICKERING LIGHT in the sand.  She pulls reins and the horse stops moments before the dune drops i nothingness.  She dismounts, affectionately scratches the horse's neck, and follows the LIGHT.  When she looks over shoulder, the Arabian is now a child's WOODEN HOBBY HORSE Not surprised, Catherine smiles and walks down a dune, sa sliding beneath her feet... She finds herself in a valley of dead trees whose decayed gnarled limbs appear to form hands.  The light dances acr her face.  She shades her eyes and pinpoints the source.. A SMALL MIRROR reflecting rays of bright sun, housed with locket and chain.  It's held by EDWARD, a haunted-looking of seven with a precocious grin and piercing eyes.  He si on a fallen tree trunk, patiently waiting for her arrival
Thanks for the horse. He's a shy child, yet comfortable with Catherine.
You liked him?
He's beautiful... Edward smiles, delighted he made her happy.
But I thought we were going sailing. The boy frowns.
You promised. A devilish glint in his eye, Edward redirects the mirror. Catherine follows the flicker to a TOY BOAT in the sand.

We can't fit into that! Edward shines light in her eyes, momentarily blinding her then snaps the locket shut.  When her vision clears, Catherine sees a GIANT SHIP perched among the dunes.  A c weighing hundreds of tons just sitting there in the deser
That'll do. She walks toward it, but Edward doesn't follow.
(coaxing him)
Come on, Mister E. She extends her hand, but he adamantly shakes his head no
What now?
(nods at the ship)
's broken. Undaunted, she... finds herself standing on the DECK.
(calling to him)
Who says?
Mocky-Lock.
Oh no... No you don't.
"Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman.  Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."
I bet we can fix it. She opens a rusted iron DOOR.  It makes an HORRIFIC SCREECHING SOUND.  Similar to metal-on-metal, but more piercing, more pained.  As if made by a living thing.
(familiar with the noise, a warning to him)
Ed-ward... The boy's FACE CONTORTS, turning into something half-huma half-animal.  A monster.  Mocky-Lock.  He SCREECHES, tryi to frighten Catherine, but she cocks her head...
We agreed.  No more Mocky-Lock. The creature sticks its tongue out and DIVES.

Edward! But it's too late!  Edward/Mocky Lock slithers into the s and disappears.  Resigning herself to a failure, she open the palm of her left hand, revealing a SMALL BUMP in the flesh between thumb and forefinger.  She presses hard and

text: We are looking at a large SCREEN showing an electronicall generated three-dimensional view of a human brain featuri color-coded neurological activity.  In a specific section the image, cells flash from yellow to red... PULL BACK TO REVEAL HENRY WEST surrounded by computers, monitors, electronics, and keyboards.  DR. MIRIAM KENT st before a peculiar diagnostic machine scrutinizing data an images.  Both wear garb favored by surgeons or microchip assemblers.  The impressive, weird computer system HUMS a shifts programs, the unusual brain image changing colors. THROUGH A LARGE WINDOW, we see into an ADJOINING ROOM wit which a HUMAN FIGURE hangs suspended in mid-air by a seri of cables designed to simulate flotation. AT THE CONSOLE, Miriam uses a pen to hit specific areas o the touch-sensitive screen, changing the complex CHEMICAL SYMBOLS displayed there. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, a series of pharmaceuticals are injected into an intravenous tube feeding the sleeve/arm the figure.  A featherweight cloth MASK electronically ri revealing the sleeping face of Catherine. AT THE CONSOLE, Miriam hits a button and speaks into an intercom microphone.
Sing a song of sixpence... IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, there is no reaction from Catherin
Sing a song of sixpence...
(hoarse, groggy)
A pocketful of rye...
Four-and-twenty blackbirds. Catherine's eyes open.

Baked in a pie... IN THE CONTROL ROOM, Henry hits a switch and Catherine is lowered to the pedestal.  Miriam checks Monitors displayi Catherine's vital signs and continuing what must be a routine, presses numbers on a keypad to open the PRESSURI AIRTIGHT DOOR separating the two areas. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, lights come on and Miriam eases Catherine out of the apparatus.  She checks her pupil dilation, pulse, throat, and reflexes.  She pokes and pro with a familiarity that would seem rude to an outside observer, but is nothing to them.  Getting to her feet, w see that Catherine's BODYSUIT is made of an unusual dark fabric almost liquid in consistency. AT THE CONSOLE, Henry moves to another section and for th first time, we see there are two elaborate neural monitor And the "brain" pictured here is smaller.  Younger...

"Mister E." is doing fine. REVEAL A SECOND FIGURE suspended from the ceiling in the PROCEDURE ROOM.  A SMALL BOY is lowered to the pedestal a as Miriam records data, Catherine removes the child's "ma displaying the haunted face of Edward.  Clearly, the boy in some kind of catatonic state.
Did we go sailing?
Almost.  Mocky-Lock showed up.
"Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman, Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."
Mocky-Lock is a pain in the ass. Henry communicates with them via the intercom.
Where did that come from again? Catherine looks annoyed - How could he forget?
A nursery rhyme. Catherine detaches the cables and eases Edward's frail bo into a waiting wheelchair.  Miriam takes a penlight and examines the boy's eyes... An emotionless void, oddly beautiful.
(thinking aloud)

Nursery rhymes, fairy tales, the bogeyman... All preparation for the horrors of the real world. Making certain the child is comfortable, Catherine covers with a blanket, rests a teddy bear on his lap, and pushes into the CONTROL ROOM, accompanied by Miriam.  Henry type a command and moves to join them.
Anybody hungry?  I'm hungry... A BUZZER sounds and ANOTHER DOOR HISSES OPEN... A constan fretting administrator, BARRY COOPERMAN, is waiting for t in the corridor.
Edward's parents are here. We can see it in Catherine's face - this isn't good news.

Situated in a corporate/industrial area north of San Dieg California, a series of well-secured buildings form a min compound.  A sign near the gate reads CAMPBELL CENTER - A DIVISION OF SUNERSET INDUSTRIES.

Although this is a hospital room filled with medical equipment, its sterility has been camouflaged with toys, posters, photographs, and drawings to make it more "homey (Some hint at aspects of Edward's fantasy world).  Every comfort has been provided and no expense spared. Henry, Miriam, and Catherine, now wearing funky/casual clothes under a lab coat, stand opposite Cooperman.  Sitt on the bed with Edward is ELLA BAINES, an elegantly dress woman in her mid-40's.  There is a soulfulness to her, bu the husband, LUCIEN BAINES, 60's, possesses the icy demea of a corporate tycoon.  One might write him off as cold, we sense a genuine love for his wife and child.  Ella smi and caresses Edward's hair.
He needs a haircut.
I'll tell the nurse. (sensing something in Edward)
God, he loves when you visit.
My husband wonders if that's true. (delivering bad news)
He wants to place Edward in a hospital. Seeing an unfunded future, Henry's ready to disassociate himself from Miriam and Catherine...
There are other applications for the scanner, Mr. Baines...
I realize that, Henry... (to Miriam)
And I know your work, Dr. Kent, is invaluable to this company...
You don't know about me, though, do you?
Catherine, we've waited eighteen months for signs of progress...
There's been progress.

Yes, but there is no proof the procedure works.  All I have is a belief that your interaction with my son is not a hallucination. Catherine is hurt and vulnerable due to exhaustion and th intensity of her experience with Edward, but feels she mu defend herself.
(to Cooperman, Miriam, Henry)
You picked me, remember?  And I took the job.  Gladly.  This is the next wave and I want to be part of it...
No one is doubting your ability.
Then what is it? Introspective and solemn-eyed, Lucien takes a moment, the

I've invested millions of dollars in this study... And I've convinced others to do the same.  I suppose I should feel responsible to them, but I don't.  I could care less if they see a profit.  I'm responsible to my boy, that's all that matters. (looks her in the eye)
You tell me... Am I doing the right thing? OFF CATHERINE'S FACE...

At first, we're not sure where we are or what's happening It's too bright, the space confining.  As our eyes adjust seem to be in a bathroom or shower stall.  We HEAR a WOMA CRYING and the camera finds ANNE VICKSEY.  Dark circles beneath eyes red and puffy from crying.  Hair wet and rat Sweater and pants damp and stained.  Barefoot, she shiver from cold and fear... PULL BACK to show more of her surroundings.  The white-ti 10' x 8' room features a SHOWER HEAD, TOILET, and a push button SPIGOT for drinking water.  Two walls are SOLID, t other two MIRRORED, the glass covered by thick clear plas The floor is littered with empty food wrappers - candy ba juice boxes.  In the center of the floor is a DRAIN and a her, on the ceiling, a FLUORESCENT LAMP, also encased in clear plastic. There is no door. A mechanism CLICKS. Then a RUMBLING... Anne seems to know what's coming.  She presses against the wall, removes her arms from the sleeves of the sweater, hunches down, and raises the garment over her head, forming a tent. WATER ERUPTS from the shower head.  There is no steam, so this water must be cold.  Shaking, Anne whispers a count herself - "One-one thousand, two-one thousand, three..." so on.  The spray hits everything in the room - mirror, toilet, floor - and a food wrapper drifts toward the drai

Thirty. She peeks up from the tent, but the water has not stopped and that isn't what she expected.  We hear a soft SUCKING NOISE and a CLICK.  The wrapper rises on a puddle of wate Anne POUNDS her fist on the wall.
(angry, scared)
A puddle forms around her feet and she realizes the drain somehow been sealed shut.  Her panic intensifies as we he another CLICK and the water pressure increases.
In the darkened procedure room, Miriam finds Catherine standing between the two suspension devices, alone.
You okay? Catherine turns, nods, and tries to smile.  Has she been crying?  Miriam steps further into the room.
He hates me.
Lucien Baines? Catherine nods.
I wouldn't say "hates."  Dislikes, distrusts, maybe. Catherine laughs.  Exactly what Miriam wanted.
She adores you.
She thinks I can bring Edward back.
Someday you can.  We all believe that... Catherine halfheartedly nods, but her mind is elsewhere, focused on the two apparatuses.
I want to try it.  Please. Miriam knows what this is about.
We've been over this a dozen times.  No.
Why not?  Just once.  A trial run.  What harm could it do?
I don't want to find out. Ever the doctor, Miriam finds herself surreptitiously examining Catherine's eyes, flesh tone, a slight tremblin her fingertips.
Why is it taking so long for us to reach him?  Because we've been reactive, that's why.  And we need to be active. Miriam reaches for Catherine's wrist and takes her pulse.
(annoyed)
Miriam...
Shush. As Miriam examines her, Catherine continues:
He creates the obstacles, he decides which games to play.
I've heard this argument before.  It's not happening.
(frustrated)
It could take years for me to get past the barriers he's created.
If we reverse the feed and bring Edward into your mind, it could be devastating for him.  Imagine the shock of suddenly existing in a whole other world.
I do it all the time!
Yes, but, you're a willing participant.  Picture Edward in a strange place, lost, frightened...
I'd be there for him.
And he might blame you for terrifying him.  That one moment could erase all you've accomplished.  And if that happened, the trust he has in you is gone.
(defeated)
Okay, okay... Miriam takes a penlight and examines Catherine's eyes.
Besides, I don't know what it might do to you.  You're already exhausted. (concerned)
Have you been sleeping? Catherine nods.
I can prescribe something... Catherine shakes her head no.  Miriam shuts off the penli and looks at Catherine with professional and personal concern.
You're sure?  Any more nightmares?
(defensively)
No.
Good.  We need you healthy and relaxed.  You're going to eat well, meditate, exercise, and watch mindless television.
Yes mother.
I don't want you up all night reading Edward's case file of the nine millionth time.  Balance, dear girl, is the key.  Leave the work here. She taps Catherine's head.
Don't bring it home in this.
Okay. Miriam gathers her belongings.
Henry wants me to try this Vietnamese place he's wild about.  Want to come?
(declining)
I've got to feed my cat.  Besides, I want to get to bed early.
That's my girl. Miriam exits, but Catherine remains, still curious what c happen if things were reversed.

The corridors are dark and most everyone has gone home. the NURSES STATION, a staff member observes the child on closed-circuit monitor.  Further down the hall, Miriam an Henry exit.  Wearing a (chic) thrift store coat and luggi worn book bag, Catherine stands outside Edward's room, watching him sleep.
Pleasant dreams, Mister E.
A GREEN FORD PICK-UP TRUCK cruises down this deserted str of two-lane blacktop, the driver carefully maintaining th speed limit.  He signals and exits...

The truck rumbles along a stretch of bumpy, unpaved road. The area is desolate, depressing, and deserted.  It feels like no one's been anywhere near here for years.  The pic stops at a RUSTED GATE and the DRIVER, a tall, lean, sine fellow undoes a combination lock-and-chain.  We do not ye see his face.

The truck parks inside a charred barn, now hidden from vi and the driver steps out, followed by his DOG. A magnificent WHITE GERMAN SHEPHERD.  We notice a GLINT i its BLUE EYES - the animal's an albino.  The driver point and whistles.  Well-trained, the Shepard sprints to the g and waits, keeping a watchful eye on the road.

From the outside, a passerby would never know this sanctu existed.  Within the foundation of a farm building never completed, we find a small room in the center of a much larger space.  The cell.  We hear the WHIR of ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT and notice VIDEO CAMERAS mounted on tripods poi at the two-way glass.  We follow CABLES to a massive VIDE RECORDER - the type used in surveillance, able to record days without maintenance, and an elaborate TIMING DEVICE connected to a series of VALVES and SWITCHES. As if in a beatific trance, the driver moves to the windo and gently rests his palm on the glass.  ANNE MOVES!  Arm flailing, mouth gasping, eyes filled with dread.  The las spark of life... The driver JUMPS, startled and frightene Almost shamefully, he turns and hides, unable to look at Suddenly, his body tenses and writhes, as if seized by torturous pain.  He opens his mouth in a silent scream. And then, quickly as it came, the pain subsides.  Hidden shadow, he breathes deeply, regaining self-control.  He waits, then moves back to the glass.  Anne's dead face fl past him.  Almost angelic.  He watches her and leans his against the window, closer.  And the driver catches his o reflection in the mirror. Meet CARL STARGHER.
Small and isolated, the nearest neighbor a block away.

The place is a mess.  Computer print-outs, dirty dishes, unopened mail, videotapes, and notepads cover tables, cha and floor.  On the crammed bookshelves, psychology texts next to volumes on mythology, religion, and the occult.  Totems, figurines and artifacts (Central and South Americ in origin) adorn the walls and tables. As Portishead plays on the stereo, we find Catherine suffering from insomnia, wearing goofy-yet-hip eyeglasses sweatpants and a UCSD T-shirt, sharing a late-night snack with her pet CAT.  She shuts the refrigerator door and we linger on an odd POSTCARD taped to the surface.  A kitsch postcard of a warrior/goddess.

We MOVE out of shadow, toward a bright focused light, following the albino German Shepherd - VALENTINE - as it enters a VAST SUBTERRANEAN ROOM.  Most of the walls have knocked down, leaving only thick support posts.  Valentin finds Stargher in a DUGOUT PIT - about five feet deeper t the rest of the room - polishing a stainless steel table. bright tungsten work light hangs above, and near it is th chain, cables and hooks of a customized MECHANICAL HOIST. The dog picks up an unpleasant scent and follows it to a corner where there are empty jugs of BLEACH sitting next long, deep cast iron TUB.  Stargher WHISTLES and Valentin obediently retreats to a KENNEL CAGE.  Stargher gives him chew toy and locks the dog inside before moving to the tu Soaking in the bleach is the nude corpse of Anne Vicksey. The interior of the tub is glazed with gleaming porcelain the whiteness of her flesh makes it appear as though she floating in nothingness, but what hypnotizes and appalls her eyes.  Wide open, transformed by the chlorine into something ghostly, they are unforgettable. As the bleach gurgles down the drain, Stargher lifts Anne from the tub and carries her to the table.  He places her face up and dries her with a clean white towel.  He moves limbs, lips, hips, and hands into desired positions then retreats into shadow.  In the harsh light, against the sh table, the bleached body has the quality of an apparition we almost expect her to move... We HEAR Stargher remove his clothes and he steps into the pool of light.  Nude, we see that his lean, muscular fram laced with some rough tatoos.  When he turns his back to we find EIGHT METAL RINGS, thick and strong, PIERCED thro his flesh.  Two columns of four on either side of the spi running from shoulder blade to just below the waist.  Wha God's name are they for? Stargher shuts off the work light and moves to an area wh he keeps TELEVISION MONITORS and VCRs.  He inserts a videocassette taken from the surveillance deck and watche the screen. In BLACK AND WHITE, we see Anne awaken in the cell.  Her first moments inside.  Disoriented, terrified, trapped, s examines her surroundings. Stargher is mesmerized by her fear.  Fast-forwarding to h death, he presses a remote and we get SOUND.  Anne scream begging for her life.  Aroused, stimulated, Stargher drin it in like a symphony.  Valentine cowers in the back of h cage, hating this.
Lying on her bed (a waterbed), Catherine sleepily stares the ceiling, rolls onto her side, and feels herself drawn into the comforter.  The folds of the fabric become rippl Ripples become dunes.

And we find ourselves in the DESERT of EDWARD'S WORLD. We fly over dunes and come up behind Catherine as she struggles through waves of sand.  The tree trunk is up ah and we glimpse someone hiding inside. Catherine reaches.  MOCKEY-LOCK ERUPTS FROM WITHIN THE TR TRUNK!  SNARLING!  Catherine retreats, silently screaming

IN HER OWN BED, Catherine's eyes are open.  In sharp cont to a typical reaction to a nightmare, she remains calm. sweaty face, no gasp, no reaction at all, really.  She mi as well have been dreaming of puppy dogs.  Wide awake, he eyes return their gaze to the ceiling.
Go.  To.  Sleep.

CHAINS attached to bizarre HOOKS dangle from the ceiling. Admiring Anne's body, Stargher links the hooks to the rin in his back.  He presses a remote unit and up in the raft a series of GEARS click into motion.  The sound is tortur as the mechanical hoist LIFTS Stargher off the ground, pulling at the rings, strips of flesh rising.  Stargher grimaces, but clearly he wants the pain, needs it.  As th hoist clicks into another gear, it carries Stargher over table until his body is perfectly positioned above Anne's In the flickering weird light of the television screen, Stargher resembles something from the twisted imagination William Blake - a levitating demon ready to debauch an innocent angel.  With his free hand, he touches himself, chains clinking and swaying.

A railroad bridge and highway span an almost-bone-dry cre bed.  Gathered beneath the overpass are the POLICE, CORON CRIMINIALISTS, AND A LOCAL FBI.  A SEDAN travels down a service road and stops nearby.  TWO MEN exit, identify themselves as FBI and move to the crime scene. Special Agent GORDON RAMSEY is well-groomed, prides himse on professionalism, and follows the Bureau party line.  Special Agent PETER NOVAK is rough around the edges, introspective, and intense.  A loner who marches to the t of a peculiar drummer, he's unconventionally handsome wit probing eyes.  He moves slowly, observing the scene - the world, for that matter - from a unique perspective. As Ramsey finds the FBI's local liaison - AGENT COLE - No oblivious to the people around him, touches dirt, smells air, and examines road, river, bridge and sky.
Who found her? Cole nods at a visibly shaken WORKMAN seated in a patrol

Surveyor for the railroad... 'Bout six this morning. Novak sees a FEMALE BODY wrapped in plastic and bound by wire.  Supervising the examination of the woman is FBI PATHOLOGIST DR. THEODORE "TEDDY" LEE, a polite, dapper southern gentleman.

Thanks for waiting, Teddy. Teddy gives Novak a friendly, respectful salute - "My pleasure."  Novak dons gloves, nods to an FBI PHOTOGRAPHE and assists Teddy Lee in snipping wire and peeling back t clear plastic.  As the photographer reacts to a strong sm Teddy comments.
Bleach. As the man snaps pictures, Ramsey and Cole join them.  Sa Novak recognizes the face.
Anne Marie Vicksey. We recognize her, too.
She the one from Santa Cruz?

Just graduated law school.  Single mom.  Had a two-year-old daughter. He and Teddy expose the bleached flesh of her torso, neit man surprised.  Coldly thorough, Novak finds another of t killer's tell-tale signs.
(instructing the photographer)
The semen on her legs and abdomen. FLASH! Photos are taken.
Someone looking after her little girl?

Grandparents.  Live over in Davis. Novak looks into the dead white eyes of Anne Vicksey, try to imagine the horrors she beheld.  He moves to the creek sees only a few inches of water.  His eyes move from the site to the highway above.

The poor thing. FLASH!  We're up there now, ON THE OVERPASS, with the photographer and Novak, examining TIRE TRACKS in the soft shoulder.  Novak peers over the edge at the crime scene, steps back, and focuses on the highway - imagining the killer's truck as it disappeared into the night.
A PRETTY YOUNG WOMAN, JULIA HICKSON, shares lunch with he fiancee, JOHN TRACY.  They talk, laugh and kiss, not a ca in the world.
As TALK RADIO plays, Carl Stargher watches them, specific Julia, his eyes never off her for too long as his hands w on something banal but unseen.
...complaining about government subsidies for farmers... The voice on the radio becomes DISTORTED as we hear it through Stargher's ears...
...but without subsidies, families will starve, and I'm nodd exagggeerrrrr....ayding.  Iff id werrrr up tooooo meeeee..... The host's voice fades into a guttural, monstrous groan.
Meeeee gawwwwwdd Caaaarrrrlll.  Mee god cum... (returning to normal)

Meeeee....wwuuuuuddunnnnttttt... be spending billions on other countries when we've got problems right here. He opens his eyes and watches John kiss Julia goodbye as returns to work.  Stargher looks down and we see what he' been working on - A TOY DOLL.  Female.  Stripped of its clothes, a single metal ring stuck through its plastic ne
His lunch finished, Ramsey is on a cell-phone talking to wife.  Chain-drinking coffee, Novak scrutinizes photos of tire tracks.
Well, honey, what's worse?  Doing it yourself or asking your mother for help? (gets his answer)
Can it wait 'til I get back/ (listens, answers)
I have no idea, Jeannie. Novak checks his watch and the street.  Clearly waiting f someone or something.
Well all right.  Good luck with the Monster.  I love you too.  Bye-bye. Ramsey snaps shut the cell-phone.
We call Jeannie's mother "The Monster" because, well... she just is. Novak is oblivious, pouring over tire-related info.
I know you could care less about my personal life, Peter, but I do appreciate the occasional, "How's your wife, Gordon?" He waits.  Novak obliges:
How is she?
Pregnant.  Thanks for asking. Novak is distracted by Teddy Lee entering the diner.
Here he is.
Damn, man, I give up.  Your partner tells you his wife's gonna have a baby, and all you care about is a coroner's report! Ramsey assesses the exhausted, lonely, intense man sittin across from him.

I feel for those girls too, Pete.  And their families.  But it's just a job.  Someday it'll be over.  And then what'll you have? Much to Novak's appreciation, Teddy Lee's arrival provide escape from answering the question.
Hot off the presses. He gives them copies of the AUTOPSY REPORT and FORENSIC ANALYSIS of Anne Marie Vicksey.  The WAITRESS sees Teddy, approaches, and offers a menu.
(doesn't need it)
Chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes, garden salad with Thousand Island dressing and an iced-tea.  Thank you darlin'. She nods and moves to the kitchen.  Novak and Ramsey flip through the documents.
Water in her lungs.  Same brand of bleach.  Match on the semen.  Lots of hair.
(unenthused)
More hair.  I could knit this guy a toupee. Novak finds something in the report that catches him by surprise.  He double-checks and shows the item to Teddy.
(reading)
So?
Anne Vicksey didn't own a dog. Ramsey checks his copy.
I need it.
Now?
Now.
A MONITOR shows a SINGLE HAIR under a video microscope.  Teddy Lee plays with the dials and gets a spectral view.
Complete absence of melanin. Novak and Ramsey stand over his shoulder.
And that means? Teddy moves aside and takes another bite of his lunch (chicken fried steak now carry-out).
The dog's an albino. (pictures it)
He'd love an animal like that.
Gentlemen, I believe an albino dog is rare indeed.
Exiting an elevator, Julia heads for her little Toyota.  Smart girl that she is, her eyes scan the area and her fingers hold a can of mace.

Julia climbs in, checks her mirror and backs up.  WHAM! she hit something??  She brakes, puts the car in park, an checks her sideview mirror. Reflected there is a WOUNDED DOG.  A white German Shepher She rolls down her window and can hear the poor thing whimpering.
Oh no...
Julia exits her car and kneels next to Valentine, who app to be in terrible pain.

God... I didn't see you. STARGHER'S HANDS COME AT HER FROM BEHIND!  One grabs her and the other covers her face with a chloroform-soaked to He presses so hard, she cannot scream, cannot move.  Afte brief struggle, he SHOVES her into her car and holds her until she passes out.  Stargher pushes Julia into the passenger seat and starts the car.  Pulls a dog treat fro his pocket and WHISTLES.  The Shepherd instantly perks up Perfectly healthy.  And jumps into the car.
(feeds him a treat)
Good boy.

In a BRIEFING ROOM we find Teddy Lee, Ramsey, Cole and lo cops.  All in need of caffeine.  They complain, gossip, a shoot the shit.  Resembling a demanding professor, Novak enters and through presence alone, lacking any self consciousness about his dishevelled appearance, takes con of the room by holding up a PHOTOGRAPH of a young woman.
Donna Krozin. (a new picture every time)
Helen Francis, Teresa Manicki... The chatter dies.
Antoinette Simms, Natalie Pagels, Grace Cassatt... Anne Vicksey. Every person is solemn and focused.

Smart, gentle, attractive young women.  Just starting out in life.  Embarking on careers, going to school, getting married... He's hooked them.  The victims, these women, now mean something to them.  With great effect, he holds up grisly post-mortem photos.
They were killed.  Kidnapped, tortured, and murdered.  By a white male.  About 30-years old. (significantly)
Who owns an albino dog./ Everyone knows this is a real clue and awareness is heightened.  Ramsey chimes in.
A purebred German Shepherd. Novak shows them a picture of a WHITE GERMAN SHEPHERD tak from a resource on the Internet.
Breeders typically destroy albino pups, so this animal is truly unique.
Nicole Labetzki.  Victim seven.  Forensics found dog hair in her car, but they had a K-9 unit at the scene and never had it checked.
The Phoenix office tested that hair thirty minutes ago.  And we got the match.
It's his dog. Ramsey holds up a thick list.
Registered breeders of German Shepherds. The list is long and a few of the cops GROAN.  Novak sile them with a fierce look that says, "I will not rest until this man is found and neither should you."

Be thorough, but be fast.  This guy's accelerating.  He only waited six days this last time.  When he started, two months could pass. A DESK SEARGENT enters the room and hands a FAX to Ramsey Novak is curious about it, but continues.
This can mean different things.  He thinks we're stupid and can't catch him.  He's having fun and needs more.  Or... (thinking it through)

This dog hair thing is sloppy.  The body this morning was found in less than three inches of water.  He knew we'd find her.  He wants to be caught.  But if we can't stop him... Gravely concerned, Ramsey moves across the room.
(dreading what's on that fax)
...he can't stop himself.
Stargher, the awful PAIN eating away at his skull.  He searches the medicine chest.
Me god feed on pain. The VOICE echoing inside his skull.
Pain good.  Cumm home to meee...

Struggling to stay on his feet, he moves to the KITCHEN.  Valentine paces nervously, whimpering concern.  Stargher reaches for a bottle of vodka but falls to the floor.  Valentine BARKS, but gets no reaction from master.  We MO IN on Stargher's unblinking eyes.
Go sleep Carl.  Me god wake up now.

Julia Hickson finds the snack foods, drinking spigot, toi shower, and drain.  Her bare feet try to adjust to the ti floor, but it's fucking cold.  She glimpses herself in th mirror and is startled by what she sees - a terrified gir

CLICK.  WATER SPRAYS FROM THE SHOWER.  Caught by surprise Julia blocks the spray with her hands and searches for a off valve.  Of course, there is none.  Thirty seconds lat the water stops. A HUMAN EYE.  No movement, no deviation of the iris.  A f stare.  The catatonic Stargher lies in a hospital bed, wr cuffed to the frame.  An IV feeds him fluids and monitors report his vital signs.  As a nervous NURSE exits, we see POLICEMEN standing guard in the outer hallway.  Novak, Ra and Teddy Lee stand by as the killer is examined by DR. MILTON REID, a brilliant forensic M.D. currently shining opthalmoscope into Stargher's eyes.  He pulls away and ch the ELECTROENCENPHELOGRAM already on a lightbox.
Minimal activity in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.  And here, the anterior cingulate cortex. (to Novak and Ramsey)
It's what helps distinguish between external and internal stimuli.
What the hell does that mean?
(answering for Reid)
He's schizophrenic. Novak doesn't like this.  Not one bit.
What're you doing here, Reid?  Paving the way for his insanity defense?
No need.  There won't be a trial.  This is no act.  The coma is real.
Whoa.  Wait a minute.
You ever hear of Whalen's Infraction? Clearly not.
(re: the EEG)
In any schizophrenic, these areas would be affected.  But in someone with Whalen's, they're hit hard and hit fast. Novak's worry intensifies.
Stargher's neurological system was infected by a virus in utero.  It lay dormant.  In his case for about... (guesses at Stargher's age)

...thirty years.  Most likely, he's exhibited symptoms for awhile now, but the infraction - the breach - didn't occur 'til today.  You never know when it'll happen, at what age, or why.  The triggers vary, but the results don't. (fascinated by Stargher)
He has no ties to reality.  No awareness of this world or the people in it.
What about Thorazine? Or... Desoxyn?
The normal psychotropics don't work.  He's not just catatonic, he's... disappeared.  Like having a dream and never waking up.
This girl.  Julia Hickson.  Only he knows where she is.
Then I'm sorry.  For her and for you. Novak is past angry.  He's bordering on devastation.  Ram attempts to placate him.
We'll go back to his house, Pete.  There's still a lot to do.  Analyze the videos, track sales of the bleach, go through his records.  Maybe he owns property somewhere.

They're in that fucking thing for forty hours, Gordon.  Four-oh.  He got Julia at seven-thirty last night.  You know what time it is now...?! I'm not... INT. CAMPBELL CENTER - LABORATORY - DAY

Catherine's face is covered by a cloth floating down from sky.  The sky is replaced by the ceiling and overhead lig of the LABORATORY, but Miriam's face remains constant.  N conscious, Catherine finds herself in the lab at the Camp Center, the suspension device lowering.
(on intercom)
Sing a song of sixpence.
(hoarse)
A pocketful of fucking rye. (worried)
What's wrong?

Nothing.

A SMALL TV SCREEN shows footage of Anne drowning in the c Catherine, Cooperman, Henry, and Miriam watch with curios disgust, pity.  Novak and Ramsey flank the portable monitor/VCR, knowing this is a disturbing but powerful to There's someone else in the room.  John Tracy.  He cannot watch the video, not again.  Catherine glances at him, uncomfortable with his presence.
When did he lapse into the coma?
Sometime yesterday morning. John tries to keep his composure, but Novak's making this tough for him.  Novak wants the scientists to see, to understand the boy's pain.

Each tape is the same.  He provides food, drinking water, a toilet.  Periodically, a shower starts.  It's on some kind of timer - he's clever with machines, building things.  I think he wants them to believe this is a simple kidnapping.  That there's a possibility of rescue.  Of survival.  But it's just a form of torture.  At the end of the fortieth hour, the drain shuts.  The water starts and doesn't stop. (gravely)
We've already lost more than a day.  If she isn't found tonight.  She dies like the rest.
(to Miriam, Henry and Catherine)
John and Ella Baines - as well as the Sunerset Board of Directors - have given their approval, but the decision is yours.
What about the legalities of this...?

Stargher is in custody.  The functional equivalent of being under arrest.  Normally, we'd Mirandize him, and if he didn't lawyer up, we'd interrogate him.  But because of his condition, he doesn't have the capacity to waive those rights.
So what you're asking us to do is illegal?
No, not at all. (explains)

We're dealing with exigent circumstances.  Somewhere there's a kidnapped woman still alive.  If we weigh the suspect's Constitutional Rights against the public safety.  The Law favors the victim and gives us a lot of leeway.  It's called the Public Safety Exception.
So what can you do?

Pretty much anything we want.  There's a chance to save a human life.  Because of that, Stargher has no reasonable expectation of privacy. Miriam, Henry and Cooperman appear to be onboard.  Novak' made a persuasive, heartfelt argument.  Only one person s remains uncertain.
What if...? All eyes turn to her.
What if he wasn't like this?  What if he was "normal?"  Conscious.  How far would you go?
As far as I needed. Catherine nods, analyzes Novak's eyes, gestures, body language, and "interrogates" him.
Do you think he'd tell you what you need to know? John's discomfort is increasing and Novak is sensitive to
There's always a chance they'll confess.

Really?  I don't work with violent cases, I work with children.  But even a kid lies.  They love it when they get you to believe something that isn't true.  Don't you think Stargher would do the same?

Sometimes... Once they've been caught they feel a need for disclosure.  They have so much they want to tell.  But they've never had a sympathetic ear.  They need someone to understand why. (focusing on Catherine)

Stargher used to hide the bodies very carefully.  It was part of the ritual.  Some weren't found for weeks and any physical evidence had been meticulously wiped clean.  But these last three... They were still in water - always in water - but (clarifies)
Listen, he wasn't just careless.  It went beyond that...

Okay.  Let's assume he wanted you to find him, that some part of him hated what he was doing... Most likely, that part is dead.  Schizophrenics with Whalen's Infraction sever all ties with the real world.  I'm sorry, I really am.
Is it possible?

If he came to trust me, yes, but it takes months to build that kind of trust.  Someone like Stargher can't distinguish between fantasy and reality.  It's all the same.  He might tell me she's in Timbuktu and absolutely, one hundred percent believe it to be true, but she's...
Julia. They turn to John Tracy.  His vulnerable, barely audible voice forcing everyone to listen.

Not "she."  Julia.  Not thing, or it, or her.  Do you know anything about her?  Do you know what we've been through?  Julia is everything to me.  Can you say that about anyone?   Catherine hangs her head.  And finds herself looking at photograph of the girl in question.  A smiling Julia Hick looking right at her. WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP.  POUNDING REVERBERATIONS...
WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP-WHOOP.  A HELICOPTER descends onto the A stretcher is removed from the side door of the helicopt
The STAFF watches with a mixture of fear and curiosity as stretcher bearing the catatonic Stargher is wheeled FAST through the corridors by an FBI escort team.

Hundreds of photographs, drawings, diagrams, maps, blueprints, and documents - Novak's case material - cover every inch of wallspace.  The table is littered with reference books, atlases, telephones, a fax machine, shor wave radio, and computer/Internet terminal.  An FBI TECHNICIAN completes the electronics work and points out "speed dial" functions to Novak and Ramsey.
(listing them)
Quantico.  San Diego Field Office.  S.D., L.A., and San Francisco P.D.  California, Arizona, Nevada State Police.  Nine and ten are open lines. (re: radio set up)
Direct link to the chopper. (re: the computer)
That gets you into the Bureau Database.
Thanks. Once he's gone, Ramsey takes this moment "alone" to quest his partner.
You sure you want to go through with this?
What else do we do?!
I don't know, Pete, but for god's sake... This is nuts.  Do you really understand what they're going to do?
I don't have to.

Why jeopardize what we've already done?  We caught the sonofabitch.  Carl Stargher.  That's going to be like Bundy, Gacy, Dahmer.  A case that makes careers.  But if we push our luck.  If this is all bullshit and we come out smelling like it.
Tell you what.  If this thing burns us, I take that heat.  I give you permission to point your finger at me and say "It was all his idea."
(offended)
That's not what I'm talking about, Pete.  I'm talking about waking up and realizing this girl's gonna die. The words are anathema to Novak.
That won't happen. Cooperman appears in the doorway and informs them...
They're ready. Ramsey looks to his partner, but Novak is already on Cooperman's heels.  Resignedly, Ramsey follows.

Following Miriam's direction, the escorts guide the gurne carrying Stargher into the procedure room.  As Cooperman shows them out, Henry seals shut the door.  Miriam assume responsibility for Stargher's care and checks his pulse, pupil dilation, and vital signs...
Shouldn't we get a catheter in him?
They took care of that, thank you, Henry. (getting him out of her hair)
Why don't you give our guests a little tour? Proud of his computer, but uncomfortable around strangers Henry directs Novak and Ramsey to the console.

Gentlemen, you stand before the one and only Neurological Cartography and Synaptic Transfer System. Although he's listening, Novak's eyes never really stray his prisoner as Miriam uses safety scissors to cut away Stargher's clothes.
It provides a highly detailed map of the human mind.  Not the brain - any MRI can do that.  The mind. (self-impressed)
It reads and processes electronically allowing information to be transferred and interrupted. (for the laymen)

Let's say your thoughts could be stored on DVD.  If someone had the right kind of player, they could watch and listen to what you're thinking. Novak observes Miriam as she "undresses" Stargher and Ram pokes around the lab.

But we can't record or store the data.  The connections between nerve cells are constantly being modified. Miriam needs a moment to fully take in the scars.  Henry continues, eager to focus attention back to him, but even is fascinated by Stargher's skin.

It's like the early days of television.  The subject sends out a live feed and you receive it during time of broadcast.  Whatever happens, happens.  All you have to do is "tune in." Miriam gives Stargher an alcohol bath, the clinical proce taking on the quality of ritual.  Her wash cloth moves un Stargher's chin and over his face.  She's careful around eyes and finds herself unable to look at them for long.

But you do more than tune in... You become part of the snow. Catherine enters from a dressing area wearing the bodysui Filled with curiosity, Novak watches Miriam and Catherine Stargher into his suit.
I still don't understand why I can't do this... This isn't some "troubled kid" you're dealing with.
I realize that...
How hard could it be...? Catherine and Miriam try to hide their laughter.
The first... What?  Six or seven times I went in.   Remember what happened?
Disorientation, nausea, migraines, hallucinations, insomnia, paranoia.
Like a New Year's Day hangover.
He needs to be turned over. Novak and Catherine roll Stargher onto his stomach.
This man is deeply disturbed, he...
You don't know the procedure.
I know him.
That may be true, but you don't have Catherine's gift.  She... (distracted by Stargher's back)
What happened here? We see a series of EIGHT BANDAGES.
We removed eight metal rings. Miriam peels away a bandage and examines the flesh.
Then he should like this. Catherine connects Stargher to the SUSPENSION APPARATUS a it HOISTS him off the table.
They're comforted by the feeling of weightlessness.  Like floating in water. Henry catches Ramsey poking his nose near a THIRD SUIT AN APPARATUS in the dressing area.

Sorry. Miriam prepares a series of CHEMICAL CARTRIDGES and loads them into a container connected to the IV-like tubes link to the suspension device.
(intimate, quiet)

She said convincingly. Catherine focuses on the procedure and makes the necessar connections.  Reluctantly, Miriam retreats to the monitor station.  She "locks down" the procedure room and joins Henry, Novak, and Ramsey at the console.
(eyes on the chemical/drug monitors)
That's the stuff?
About twelve years of research, right Miriam?
Don't remind me.
What is it - are they - exactly? That's like asking her to explain the rules of cricket.

Psychostimulants, serotonin, stabilizers, meprobamate, Neurontin, lithium carbonate.  And my baby.  It duplicates and expands upon the effects of a chemical called oxytocin, forcing a break in the neuron connections that hold experience.  So new experience can form. Ramsey is utterly lost and just sort of nods, but Novak i fascinated.  Catherine presses the bump on her hand.  A R INDICATOR LIGHT flashes on.

Although none of what she experiences is real, she can be tricked into thinking it is.  The mind is awfully gullible, so she needs to monitor herself. Catherine and Stargher are suspended from the ceiling.  H types and the lights dim to a more somber, tranquil level Various screens flicker to life, displaying the vital sig of both "feed" and receive."  Miriam initiates the inject program.
Catherine?  I'm about to start.  If you want me to wait, or...
No.  No. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, we see chemicals mix with her bloo then feed the IV.  AT THE CONSOLE, as Henry types furious at the computer keyboard, Novak asks Miriam:
You said she has a "gift." Overhearing, Henry interrupts, pointing at a section of Catherine's "mind map."
Not a gift.  A highly evolved area in her cerebral cortex, that's all.  A genetic fluke.
Catherine has a tremendous capacity for empathy. (clarifies)

When we started, there were a number of test subjects - other therapists - who acted as "receivers."  All they did was observe and report.  Nothing more.  But Catherine, she had the ability to feel what was happening.  She understood.  And the patient responded.  Edward engaged her in dialogue, took her places, showed her things.  He knew she cared. A hopeful, solemn Novak gazes through the window, watchin Catherine's body as it becomes parallel to Stargher's... IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Catherine takes a deep breath and the drugs take effect, feels herself losing consciousness She glances at Stargher, a man who tortures and kills wom then looks up as the CLOTH MASK descends from the ceiling
Intravenous administration complete.
Initiating connection. We follow fibrous wires running from Catherine's mask to Stargher's.  Their blood mixing with chemicals in the IV- containers.  The computer system humming.

Transfer begins 1100 hours, 34 minutes, 12 seconds. Catherine's eye focuses on the mask.  As it comes closer, see the lining is laced with thread-like wires and microc forming hyper-miniature circuit boards.  Catherine's eye blinks.  The mask covers her face.  Catherine's eye shuts Vision fades.  Darkness.  A faint light.  Microscopic vei in the eyelid become wires connected to chips.  And we're MOVING, into the circuitry.

The pattern of the electronics grows into something more organic, textured, concrete.  Evolving into a world.  Bla and shadow-filled, it resembles a labyrinthine complex of vertical walls with cubicle like rooms carved deep into i core. Our journey into this bleak, grim place continues and we occasionally glimpse brief images of a boy's baptism. INTERCUT with this journey are sections of cloudy blackne and fragmented visions of CATHERINE connected to the apparatus, face masked, DESCENDING into this world. There is an abrupt SHIFT from still images to regular mot and we find ourselves gliding over a tidepool filled with tiny fish and tadpoles.  At water's edge, lying on rough, pebble-strewn ground, is a HAND. Catherine's hand.  We sense MOVEMENT, but she remains sti From the darkness comes a DOG.  Black in color and featureless, it sniffs Catherine, dismisses her, and mean into a cubicle opposite her, disappearing from view.  Aft moment of odd quiet, a DROP OF BLOOD hits the mask and we follow Catherine's hand as it moves to the cloth and remo it from her own face. IN MACROSCOPIC SUPER SLOW-MOTIONS, another BLOOD DROPLET sails 64 into the air and comes crashing down, hitting a ANT, catapulting it onto what looks like a tree, but is j a TWIG.  As the insect scurries away, MORE DROPS pound th earth, splatter against "twig trees," and explode into po of stagnant water... As we begin to realize that this miniature landscape is t world into which Catherine descended. She sits up, shivering, and breathes deeply, acclimating her surroundings.  The "floor" is covered with filth, ash pebbles, and insects.  Water is present in many forms, puddles, moisture, dripping ceilings. THE BLACK DOG stands in the opposite room next to a tub f of BLOOD, shaking himself dry after his "bath."  Satisfie the animal stops and trots away. She loo around, then through a crack in the "floor," briefly catc sight of a BOY beneath her, on a level lower than hers. he disappears into corridor ending in "nothing," we PULL to show a MASSIVE LANDSCAPE of blocks, cubicles, crawlspa walls, stairs, and ladders.  Leading everywhere and nowhe Catherine spots the boy as he crawls into a specific "roo Shortly after, a LIGHT comes on within the cubicle and sh moves to it.  We feel as though we're looking at a series interlocked tenement rooms, some walls of which have been torn away to expose rooms within, rooms with no windows o doors.  Following a path of fragile steps, Catherine make her way to the LIGHTED ROOM and enters.

A mottled HORSE stands with its head down, nose kissing t floor, allowing the BOY to caress its neck.  This sweet animal is an incrongruous vision in this hellish world an Catherine approaches with respect.

Cather allows the mare to smell her, then vigorously scratches a the mane and shoulder, much to the horse's delight.

His name's Edward.  The boy, not the horse... The boy takes a few steps toward her, out of the shadows, he seems more concerned about something in the ceiling th "connecting" with Catherine.  Very anxiously, he looks at wall behind Catherine and watches an old wind-up kitchen TIMER click down.

What's wro---? Young Stargher RUNS at her and SHOVES her hard!  Catherin FALLS BACK just as EIGHT SHEETS OF GLASS drop from the ceiling!  Like oversize razor blades, they slice the hors into four clean sections.  They separate and compact the quadrants until four glass-contained sections of dissecte horse stand within the room.  Catherine SCREAMS, but the barely acknowledged what happened.  Betraying no emotion, boy runs.  The shaken Catherine takes a moment to collect herself, then gives chase.

Young Stargher knows his way around the landscape, but Catherine has difficulty simply keeping him in sight.  Sh runs, climbs and crawls.  Until she's utterly lost and disoriented.  Tired and having difficulty breathing, she drops to her knees and "cools down."  She hears a NOISE nearby, gets to her feet, and finds a GEARED MECHANISM connected to some kind of SHUTTERED DOOR composed of an almost metallic-looking glass.  Curious yet cautious, she examines the nearby walls, floor, and ceiling for any sig of "traps" akin to the glass blades.  Finding none, she p the mechanism and quickly steps back. As she mo out of a darkness, we see VICTIM ONE. Ghostly pale and adorned in eerie fetish garb, she appear "sense" the presence of a stranger, targets Catherine in shadows, and ATTACKS! Catherine's had enough and moves to press the implant, BU

She brutally grabs Catherine, THROWS her against the wall SMACKS her head against it.  Catherine drops to the floor like a rag doll. Victim One hefts Catherine onto her shoulder and with gre purpose, carries her deep into the labyrinth, toward the core. Wearing what could be seen as CEREMONIAL GARB, a silent, solemn Stargher King prepares himself for executi of a ritual by polishing and arranging an assortment of shiny, sharp, macabre TOOLS. Novak shuts his eyes and silently tells himself, Not real He opens them, breathes deeply and focuses on Catherine.

You're Catherine Young.  You majored in Psych at UC San Diego.  You work for Sunerset Industries. Stargher King's fingers pass over an array of horrific instruments - the throat piercer/collar mechanism, a clea knife, a misshapen hammer, a long slender needle...
Your grandmother raised you after your parents died in a car crash... Stargher King lifts the blade-like NEEDLE.  So far, Cathe looks at Novak like he's speaking gibberish.

(reminding himself)
Not real, Pete...This is not real... (urgency)

Stargher King grabs his throat and traces the blade down center of Novak's torso.  Novak struggles and pleads with Catherine.
I know this because I work for the FBI.  Peter Novak, remember?!?! (a desperate request)
Remember.  You are Cath- Stargher King cuts his flesh and INSERTS the needle into stomach.  NOVAK SCREAMS!  This fucking hurts!
Help me!!! Stargher King wiggles the needle, pulls it out, and digs finger into the wound.  NOVAK CRIES IN PAIN.
(tears forming, horrified)
Fucking FEELS real! The intensity of Novak's cries hit Catherine like a thunderbolt.  There's a glimmer of life, of recognition i her eyes.
(finally speaking)

Me god gut you like a dear. Although we don't see it, we HEAR something awful.  Like Stargher King fishing around inside the wound.  A pale, sweating Novak tries to stay conscious.  He will not go i shock...
Not real.  Not real.  Not real. A FEMALE HAND grabs the tool from the tray.
(mimicking Novak, laughing)
Nod reel, nod reel, nod reel...

THING THROUGH HIS THROAT!   As Stargher King stumbles awa gagging, blood pouring form his neck, we see that she has returned to normal.  The "bride" persona is gone.  As Stargher King emits animalistic growls, Catherine turns a sees an intact Novak standing next to her.  As if nothing happened. Catherine and Novak RUN out of the den, into the tunnel f which Novak gained access.  He stops, ready to press the sensor, when a FLICKER OF LIGHT dances across Catherine's face.
Wait...
Like hell "wait." But she won't listen and he's forced to play catch up as moves further from the den toward the cliff face.  The FLICKER OF LIGHT shines on the entrance to a specific TUN

On her hands and knees, she enters the TUNNEL, not waitin for him to respond.  She knows what he'll do... Catherine Novak crawl through the dark, grimy claustrophobic space, playing with his mirror locket.
Carl... He so desperately wants her affection, but fear prevents from reaching out to her.
This is Peter. Scared, he shakes his head "no."
Don't be scared.  You're my friend and I would never hurt you. She extends her hand.  Oh-so-hesitantly he takes it.

Will you take us to her?  To Julia? Shyly, hesitantly, he nods.  She smiles gratefully and affectionately touches the boy's face.  Clasping her hand Young Stargher leads Catherine and Novak into utter darkn

More stylized than the actual cell, it's bigger and ornat decorated, with the atmosphere of a church.  Individual IMAGES hang like SHRINES, each showing Julia Hickson from different angles. The child looks at Catherine with beatific, sa eyes, regarding her as one would a saviour.
Where the hell are we?
Carl, do you know?  Like on a map... He shakes his head and buries his face in her shoulder.
It's okay, it's okay.  You helped so much already.  I'm proud of you. As a frustrated Novak searches for anything identifying, Catherine comforts the boy and looks deeply into his sad, haunted eyes.
Carl, I think I can help you.  Would you like that?  Even if Peter can't find Julia, I want to help you. The boy leans against her and she caresses his face.

I promise. Novak finds himself standing in front of the idealized ce Mounted beneath the glass is a shiny, perfect metal plaqu reading CARVER INDUSTRIAL EQUIPMENT, with a logo.  Novak recognizes it from the hoist in Stargher's basement.
Let's go. He pulls her to her feet.  Feeling betrayed and rejected, child breaks away from her.  THE ROAR OF STARGHER KING sh the cell.  Terrified, the boy searches for a place to hid
Novak feels what's coming.
I can't leave him! STARGHER KING APPEARS!  His throat wounded, bloody mess, descends out of dark nothingness, HOWLING with rage.  He reaches for Catherine, but Young Stargher runs in front o her.

They're back. Everything happens fast.  He and Miriam frantically cease procedure.  Novak and Catherine are lowered and Novak startles them b quickly regaining consciousness.  Miriam attempts to inje him with stabilizing drugs, but he's already trying to te himself out of the apparatus.
Get me out! Miriam MOVES into the PROCEDURE ROOM.

Miriam tries to follow protocol, but Novak is moving like fish caught in a net, ripping and tearing his way out of apparatus and suit.  He gets to his feet, but soon falls his knees, dizzy and disoriented.
Don't move! Novak is not listening.  Fighting off any after-effects- physical and mental - he moves for the door.
Agent Novak! Catherine is coming back and Miriam moves to her.  Novak pauses just for a moment.
Is she alright?
Yes.  But you're going to sit down right now.  I have to... Novak is already gone.
Novak speed-dials a number on speaker-phone, hurriedly dresses, and locates a photograph of Stargher's basement. When he hears someone pick up the line, he barks:
This is Novak, who've I got? A confused Ramsey enters and listens.

A team of FBI AGENTS is meticulously going through every of Stargher's house.  Crisscrossed wooden beams have been laid across the pit allowing forensics experts to search without disturbing anything.  On the other end of the direct line is COLE...
Agent Cole. (INTERCUT WITH NOVAK AND RAMSEY)
I need you to find something in the basement...
Already there.
That hoist, with the winch... WE FOLLOW Cole as he moves to the machine.
There's some kind of plaque, a metal plate, with a logo.  On the base. Cole locates it.
(reading)
Carver Industrial Equipment.
Novak instructs him...

Find out the history of that machine.  Who bought it, used it, sold it.  And check Stargher's pay stubs.  I want to know every contractor he worked for.  I'm calling you from the chopper in ten minutes. Dizziness and disorientation again hit Novak.  Pale and sweating, he winces as his stomach agonizingly cramps.
Jesus Christ, man, you look like hell.
Considering where I've been... Fighting the pain, he gathers together MAPS, slips on his shoes and grabs gun and holster.  Ramsey is apoplectic.
Whoa-whoa-whoa.  Mind telling me what the fuck is happening? Novak points to the photo of Stargher's basement, specifically the hoist.
You're bettin' the farm on something you saw after they pumped you full of god knows-what kind of shit?
I saw her.  Julia.  Alive.  I saw everything.
You might've seen Jimmy Hoffa dancing with Timothy Leary.  I don't care. Novak is not stopping...
IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam shines the penlight into Catherine's eyes.
...a pocketful of rye.
Four and twenty blackbirds...
Baked in a pie. AT THE CONSOLE, on a security monitor, Henry can see Nova and Ramsey exiting down the corridor.
The FBI has left the building. IN THE PROCEDURE ROOM, Miriam appears concerned.
Damn him.
What's wrong?
Agent Novak.  I didn't get a chance to clear him. Catherine encourages her.
Go.  I'm fine.  Go. As Miriam hurries to catch Novak, she tells Henry.
Keep an eye on her. He nods, but isn't really paying attention.  Catherine tu to Stargher's motionless form, still suspended, still connected to the machinery.

Do something, Julia. She looks around the room and runs her hands along the wa the tile, looking for a weak spot.  She focuses on the CEILING PANEL and although it's painful because of swolle fingers, removes her ENGAGEMENT RING.
A ready-and-waiting HELICOPTER is on the pad.  Novak race out of the Center, Ramsey right behind him, SHOUTING at e other in order to hear above the chopper noise.

Pete, listen to me.  What did you really learn in there?  Anything new?  You really think Stargher gave you a save the-day clue?  What if this is all some kind of trick your head is playing on you? He won't consider that.  Novak climbs into the helicopter buckles himself in.  He looks to Ramsey - you coming? - Ramsey pats the side of the chopper and signals for the p to take off.
Henry analyzes voluminous print-outs from the last proced Although his eyes are on the data, he converses with Catherine in the PROCEDURE ROOM via intercom.
...there was a moment when we thought we'd lost Agent Novak as well. We see chemicals flow and computer programs initiate the procedure, but Henry is oblivious.
His post-procedure consciousness recovery was remarkably quick.  Never saw that before.  Hey, remember that one time... He JUMPS when the door to the procedure room SEALS SHUT a mechanisms HUM.
Catherine? When he looks through the window, Catherine is again suspended, the procedure under way.

What are you doing? He types in a command, but nothing happens.  He tires aga On another keyboard, but gets no response.  When he looks the "map" screens, he sees something odd.  It's a small change, but it makes all the difference in the world. INT. THE CELL - DAY

Like a rock climber in a crevasse, Julia shimmies up the walls of the cell by bracing herself in a corner and usin her hands and feet to push up.  The tile is slippery and movement precarious. She uses strength and balance to reach a position just be the Plexiglass, the fluorescent light bathing her in an e intense glow.  She sees a gap between the glass and the w and uses her ENGAGEMENT RING to dig into it, SCAPE, SCRAP SCRAPING with the diamond. THE SHOWER SPRAYS WATER!  Julia nearly loses her balance, manages to stay pressed into the corner.  She kicks the shower head, sending the spray as far from her as possibl and continues to dig at the caulking around the light fixture. IN THE OBSERVATION ROOM, we see something unexpected.  Th clock reads 00:00:00.  That water isn't going to stop.
Miriam and Ramsey return to the lab to find Henry anxious observing from the console.
(flustered)
She changed the codes.
What's wrong?
It would take hours to re-route the system, and even if I did, I shouldn't.
What are you talking about? Miriam analyzes the situation and regretfully, angrily, worriedly realizes what's happened.
She's done it.  Stupid, stupid girl...
Done what?
Instead of going into his mind...
She's bringing Stargher into hers.

A bright, deliriously colorful realm visually reflective things we saw in Catherine's home.  Unusual trees, rock formations, totems, statues, and a brilliant POOL OF WATE The pond ripples.  Visible through the crystal-clear wate YOUNG STARGHER, rising to the surface like a drowning vic suddenly breaking through to air.  Panicked, he scrambles shore and pulls himself to land.  Although the place is comforting and beautiful, he's in strange territory and i frightens him.  Shivering, he hunches down, eyes darting way and that.

You're all right, Carl. The boy turns toward the voice and finds CATHERINE, her h waving in the wind, skin glowing, eyes bright, cutting a magnificent figure in clothes that make her a warrior goddess.  She opens her arms and the boy runs to her, basking in th comfort of her embrace.  He shivers and she holds him tightly.
It's okay, honey, you're with me now.  You're safe here. She looks deeply into his eyes and reassuringly explains.
I promised I would help you, and I always keep my promises.
Can... Catherine is astonished and relieve to hear him speak.  A sad, trembling little voice.
Can I stay here? She is touched that he would ask and strokes his face.
(regretfully)
Oh...no, honey, I'm sorry.  It's doesn't work that way. The boy breaks away from her, turning his back.  She gent takes his hand but he yanks it free.
But what if I told you you could come visit? He slowly turns to her.

I'll make sure it happens, Carl.  I'll get them to let me do it.  And maybe... maybe we can... Young Stargher's eyes open wide with silent terror.  Over shoulder, she sees a SNAKE slither through the pool.  CENTIPEDES CRAWL over her legs and hair.  She stands and brushes them off.  The atmosphere grows darker and ominou
He found me... Catherine bristles as STARGHER KING RISES FROM THE POOL l a human serpent.  The brilliant colors of Catherine's wor fade to GRIM TONES.
He always finds me. Stargher King SCREECHES with anger and confusion.
Where thiisss att?!?!  Me god no like id here... He snarls when he sees Catherine.
You.  Priddy bish-hor-kund.  You big trubble-mekker... (sneers at the boy)
And you.  You cumm home now, liddle cogsugger worm.  Or me god haffa punish you... Young Stargher tightens his embrace of Catherine.  She st back, away from the pond, hugging the boy tightly.
No.!
No?!??!?!?!? Stargher King laughs.
Hoo you thing you are?? Himm Muther? He comes close and reaches for the boy...

You gimme liddle worm. For a moment, Catherine appears frightened and intimidate Perhaps near an emotional breakdown.  But that is not the case.  She quietly lowers little Carl to the ground and whispers something in his ear.  As the boy nods, runs and hides, a ferocity grows within her.

I said no. Like a vengeful Valkyrie, she emits what can only be call BATTLE CRY!  STARGHER ATTACKS!  Arms reaching for her.  Catherine BLOCKS, PUNCHES, AND KICKS.  Stargher King doub over.  Catherine grabs his ears and pulls his face into h bent KNEE, breaking his nose.
Welcome to my world. As blood flows from his nostrils, Stargher King grins...

You funny.  You thing you stop me god? HE CHARGES.  At the right moment, Catherine sidesteps and SMASHES him in the ribs as he passes.  Stargher King crum to the ground and she KICKS an uppercut to this chin.  Ri from the mud and muck, Stargher King lands a POWERFUL BLO her head, sending her flying.  He lifts the stunned Cathe with one hand and pulls her face to his...

You cum back wif me god.  You be good bish-hor-kund... Catherine looks into his soulless eyes.  Then SPITS in th and BITES his face!  She breaks free as he YOWLS with pai He steps toward her, but his feet don't move.  The earth itself appears to wrap around them and turn hard, like concrete.  Stargher King HOWLS with frustration.
My world... A SHIMMERING KNIFE seems to enrage from within her forear out the flesh and into her hand.
My rules. She SLASHES across his chest, drawing blood.
No! Catherine stops.  And turns to see the distraught Young Stargher.
Don't hurt him! She spins around and sees not Stargher King, but MARTIN.
He didn't mean it.  I was bad. Disturbed by the transformation, Catherine backs away.  H vision blurs, the sound distorts.  And the earth cracks around Stargher King's ankles.
He teached me a lesson.  I deserved it. Fighting feelings of disorientation, she kneels before th child and rests the knife on the ground.

No one deserves it, Carl.  No one. She reaches out to him, but the child is JERKED into the by Stargher King.  In one hand, the monster holds little Carl.  In the other - a KNIFE.  His face and chest red wi crimson, Stargher King fixes his eyes on Catherine with a predator's stare.

Yer world.  My knife. Stargher King raises the blade toward the boy's throat an SNAP!  The strong arms of an adult Stargher breaks his ar the elbow.  Both the knife and boy are dropped to the gro as Stargher King YOWLS like a stuck pig, the good arm cradling the other.
Me god hurt!  Why you do that?  Why?!
Enough. Stargher King regards him with disgust.
Enuff?!?! MARTIN STARGHER'S VOICE comes from the belly of the beast
I'll tell you what's enough... Stargher and Stargher King square off.  The boy stands between them with the knife at his feet.
Carl!
(still speaking as Martin)
Shut up cunt. (to the boy)
Give it here, worm... the child picks up the blade and stands between them, loo to Catherine for guidance.
(as Martin)
You want a mommy?  Is that what you want? In an almost dream-like motion, the child hands the blade adult Stargher.

Enough. And he DRIVES the thing into Stargher King's heart.  For brief moment, Martin's face is superimposed over Stargher King's.  Stunned, he slumps and regards adult Stargher wi sad, troubled eyes.
(as Stargher King)
Why?  What'd I do?... Stargher TWISTS the handle of the blade and Martin/Stargh King drops dead.   Dead.  Young Stargher smiles and hugs Catherine.
Time to go 'way.
Carl...? The boy runs to adult Stargher who lifts the child into h arms and holds him close.
Bye. She looks to adult Stargher and begins to understand.  He descends into the pool, the boy resting his head on his shoulder.

Thank you, Catherine.  You did help me.  More than you'll ever know. Man and boy disappear beneath the water's surface.  Cathe stands and sees that Stargher King's body has vanished.  She walks to the shore and sees, deep underwater, Starghe and little Carl floating lifelessly like women in the cel And FADE FROM VIEW.
Goodbye Carl. She presses the sensor in her hand.
IN THE CONTROL ROOM, Miriam is shocked by what she sees o the monitors and looks at Stargher.

He's in full arrest. Catherine quietly returns to consciousness and is automatically lowered.  She pulls the mask from her face, rises and opens the door.  Miriam races inside and desperately attempts to revive Stargher.  But it's no use Angry and stunned, she demands of Catherine.
Help me! But Catherine chooses not to.  She knows Carl Stargher wi never return to the world of the living.

The chopper roars across the sky.  As they head northeast away from the urban and toward the rural, Novak gazes out window, trying to stay focused, fighting any after-effect the drugs.  The pilot communicates via headset.
Agent Novak?  Go ahead.
Cole?
Cole and a handful of other agents pour into waiting Suburbans.  (INTERCUT WITH NOVAK IN HELICOPTER).

Lattimer sold the hoist to a guy named Bainbridge who tired to build a machine works out near Delano.  Bainbridge ends up in bankruptcy court and the state winds up with the land - it's just sitting there.
Delano?

Julia is entirely underwater but alive.  She uses the str to suck oxygen through the gap in the ceiling, but it's difficult to tread water and her lungs are aching.

Julia tries to hold herself up by pressing her arms and l against the walls, but as she does, the straw slips from mouth.  She reaches for it, but only succeeds in pushing away from her.  It heads for the drain.  And disappears.
The helicopter lands and Novak jumps out.  He knows this the place.  He runs into the barn, but there's nothing, n sign of her.  The pilot looks at him with a true sense of loss.

As Julia desperately tires to find the straw through the holes of the drain, we see for the first time an expressi which tells us she's given up.  THUMP-THUMP-THUMP.  The c starts to vibrate.  A repetitive noise WHUP-WHUP-WHUP - c from above.  She swims to the top of the cell and POUNDS the ceiling.
Fighting exhaustion and the side effects of the drugs, No pushes on.  Think, Peter, think... His eyes find the WATE TANKS and he SHOUTS at the helicopter.

Cut the engine! As the motor dies, Novak listens and listens.  There it i Water pipes beneath his feet.  And very faintly, a poundi He follows the sound, searching the earth.  It's clearer louder.  Novak tosses aside rusted junk and the pilot run assist him.  Together, they expose the entrance to the underground sanctuary.

Novak drops to the floor below.  Instantly affected by th similarities and the differences to the idealized cell of Stargher's mind, he feels another wave of dizziness, but pushes on. And is hit hard by the sight of DROWNED JULIA, her motion body floating past him.  HER EYES OPEN and bubbles drift her nose and mouth.  Novak BANGS on the Plexiglas and cal to her.
The thick Plexiglass still remains, but she now can see h Novak pulls his ID BADGE and smacks it against the glass.

He pulls his gun and takes aim.  Julia swims to the top o the cell and presses herself against the ceiling.  BANG-B BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG.  Novak fires a circle of shots into thick plastic.  Water slowly leaks, but the damn thing is still solid.  He lifts the industrial VCR and RAMS it at bullet-damaged section.  CRACK! CRASH!  WATER POURS FROM CELL.  Julia's body descends on the torrent of water.  No reaches inside and pulls her to safety.  He's just about give her CPR when she coughs, sputters, and thirstily dri in oxygen.  Holding her tightly, Novak sinks to the floor the water from the cell spilling everywhere.
Cole's Suburban leads a contingent of FBI vehicles and lo police cars onto the property, sirens blaring.
Hearing the sirens, Novak relaxes.  For the first time in knows how long, he relaxes.  And holds Julia Hickson as i his life depended on it.
Two cars parked outside.  An old, quirky Volvo and a Land Rover.

As a television plays THE WIZARD OF OZ, we find Catherine watching the movie from the couch, sitting up, drinking a of tea. IN THE KITCHEN, Miriam packs up her stethoscope and blood pressure monito moves into the living room as Dorothy falls asleep in a f of poppies...

I'll come by tomorrow after work.  With dinner.

Give a kiss to Edward. The women exchange smiles and Miriam exits.

Agent Novak.
Dr. Kent.

Ready. He opens the door and escorts a leashed VALENTINE into th living room.  Catherine's cat squirms from her arms and h under the couch.
That went well.
Give her a minute. (smiles at the dog)

Absolutely. (calling for the cat)
Abigail... Valentine picks up the cat's scent and sniffs around the of the sofa.
I heard Julia and John got married.

Good for them. Valentine settles on the floor.  Slowly, Abigail's curios gets the best of her and she creeps out, sniffing the dog nose.  Patient and sweet, Valentine lies still, allowing cat to reach an acceptable level of comfort.
Well look at that.
I told you.  You have to be optimistic.  Believe in them...
So you say. Amazingly, Abigail brushes up against the dog and purrs.
He's mine?
All yours.  My boss says it's one of the strangest requests the Bureau's ever had. Catherine laughs.  She likes that.
He also says that until proven differently, Julia Hickson was found as a result of good old-fashioned detective work.
It doesn't matter...
I don't know.  I think it does. (genuine concern)
You know, Catherine... If you ever want to talk about it.  What happened to Stargher.  That last time. It's painfully clear the thought of it still troubles her

They're hungry.

I got it. He moves into the kitchen. And she looks away, unabl watch, disturbed by the image.  She turns to the kitchen sees Novak feeding an appreciative dog and cat.  He rises returns to the living room.
Thank you.
No problem.
No.  Thank you. He smiles and nods, gently resting his hand on her should Catherine shuts her eyes and leans toward him, comforted simple human touch...
